data.title: The Last Book in the Universe
data.meta_description:
by Rodman Philbrick

Has anybody read this book?
It is so good. And if you like the Hunger Games or Uglies series, this might be right up your alley....
data.text:
by Rodman Philbrick

Has anybody read this book?

It is so good. And if you like the Hunger Games or Uglies series, this might be right up your alley. It's a super easy read. My daughter (10th grade) and son (7th grade) just had to read it for school. I read it last year and loved it so much I bought the book. (I NEVER buy books. LOL -that's what the library is for, right?)

Anyhoo, my son has to do a project about the book. He currently has a D+ in the class, so not like him. Little turd. And so he HAS to do good on this project. So, obviously, I am helping him, probably helping him too much. (Thank goodness I read the book! HA!)

He has to come up with 25 NEW words........ The book uses/makes up words for items, people and places in the book. If you've read the book you'll understand. But he has to come up with a dictionary definition, pronunciation AND a picture... for 25 words!!! OY! and it's due tomorrow. LOL

ofcourse, he didn't tell me that last part until Tuesday. Oy, again, he's a turd. HAAAAAAAA

Last night we finished all the word definitions, today he has to draw 25 pictures. Gonna be hard for verbs and places. AND extra hard for him because despite his D+ grade he is sooooooooooo the smart/perfectionist type and NOT much of an artistic bone resides in his little 13 year old body. ROFL.

So, again, I am helping him a bit more than I should on this project, but he HAS to get an A. End of Story. LOL

However, I'm finding it difficult coming up with images for words like:

bork off, googan, holoquarium, mope, proov and needlebrain.

BUT thankfully, words like:

carboshake, choxbar, chetty blade, splat gun and takvee should be much easier. LOL
